channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Unanimous Supreme Court makes it easier to sue schools in disability cases
item.description: Chief Justice John Roberts wrote the unanimous opinion, with Justice Clarence Thomas, joined by Justice Brett Kavanaugh, and Justice Sonia Sotomayor, ...

item.title: Supreme Court says family can sue over wrong-house raid
item.description: A unanimous Supreme Court said a family whose house was wrongly raided by law enforcement can sue.

item.title: Almost all of the Fulbright board resigns, citing Trump administration interference
item.description: Former Fulbright Foreign Scholarship Board members said the Trump administration usurped their authority by denying awards to "a substantial number" o...

item.title: The GOP's massive bill would benefit the rich the most -- while hitting the poor
item.description: The top 10% of earners in the U.S. would see the biggest gains under the GOP tax and spending package, according to congressional forecasters, but tho...

item.title: Why there's an unexpected surge in people claiming Social Security
item.description: Some early filers say worries about the future under the Trump administration moved up their timelines.

item.title: Spanish PM sorry for corruption scandal as opposition demands resignation
item.description: Pedro Sánchez faces mounting pressure after an escalating corruption scandal brought down a senior colleague.

item.title: Supreme Court revives lawsuit from Atlanta family whose home was wrongly raided by the FBI
Trump administration’s use of troops to help with immigration raids faces test in court
item.description: President Donald Trump’s use of troops to help carry out intensified immigration raids faces its biggest challenge yet on Thursday.

item.title: Watchdog finds Iran failing to meet nuclear obligations for first time in 20 years
item.description: Iran condemns the resolution passed by the IAEA's board of governors as "political" and says it will open a new uranium enrichment facility.

item.title: House Intelligence Committee set to review Ukraine report Monday, vote expected Tuesday
item.description: The House Intelligence Committee is set to review a report on the impeachment inquiry Monday. They are expected to vote to adopt the report on Tuesday...

item.title: Gayle King sits down with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and wife Priscilla Chan
item.description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Priscilla Chan talk with Gayle King in their first joint TV interview. The three discussed why Facebook has ...

item.title: "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell" moves to Washington, D.C.
item.description: "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell" will be the only network evening news broadcast based from the nation's capital. Watch Monday, December 2.

item.title: Harvard researcher charged with smuggling frog embryos is released from federal custody on bail
What we know so far after Air India flight to London crashes in Ahmedabad
item.description: More than 200 people were on board the flight to London Gatwick when it crashed shortly after take-off.

item.title: British man is only passenger to survive India plane crash
item.description: Vishwashkumar Ramesh is believed to have survived the Air India crash that killed at least 200 people.

item.title: 300+ Trump ads taken down by Google, YouTube
item.description: 60 Minutes finds over 300 video ads for President Trump were taken down, mostly over the summer, for violating company policy

item.title: Mistrial declared on rape charge in Weinstein case after juror won't return to jury room
item.description: Weinstein was already found guilty of one sexual assault count, after an earlier conviction was overturned.

item.title: Air India crash puts spotlight on Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner safety
item.description: An Air India crash Thursday involved a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, which the aircraft manufacturer first delivered 14 years ago.
